ygData.subject: RE: CoD and DDD damage.
ygData.msgSnippet: These undead s in Kith have strong resists to MR.  I use elemental with my MM drum for as high MR as possible for our party - at least for the few opening
ygData.messageBody:
These undead's in Kith have strong resists to MR. I use elemental with my
MM drum for as high MR as possible for our party - at least for the few
opening rounds - then switch to weps if the party needs me to melee. I was
in a group and someone was dispelling them and that really seemed to help.
I have been using my FulFil's Curtailing chant to open and get that -10 mr
on them and then hit them with chains or a bellow if someone else has them
snared. And then if snared good and they are at or near half health -
screetch. Hehe fun to make them flee and it stops their attacks on you.

Sylly

-----Original Message-----
From: Bard [mailto:dabard@...]
Sent: Sunday, November 21, 1999 4:26 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] CoD and DDD damage.

In my camping of the Icy Greaves last week, and last night's
grouping in Kith, taking out high-level undead (the lowest thing con'd gold
to me at 28) I have noticed that although DDD may be more powerful, CoD will
be resisited by higher level creatures MUCH less often. About the only
things that resisted it were red cons that were upper 30's-ish to maybe 40.
Don't take my word for it, try it yourself and see ;o)


-=B=-
The Rathe
-----Original Message-----
From: Brangwen <brangwen@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, November 21, 1999 2:34 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] CoD and DDD damage.


>From: "Brangwen" <brangwen@...>
>
>DDD gives you just the "blahblah winces" message like CoD-
but it is VERY
>powerful! Make sure you put at least one point into your
brass skill when
>you train (i put a all I could as soon as I could) because
it does take a
>bit to fire up this song when you first start using it. I
did ask a high
>level bard what the best thing to do to max the song out
was and he said go
>to freeport newbie area... it did help, then I used it in
EC in the easier
>area and that helped, finally I got too impatient, so I
just started using
>it along with the other two (CoD and Hymn) and in 5 days it
went from 30 or
>40something to it being in the 70s now - can't wait until
it catches the
>rest of my instruments! One of the things I have found was
that I've started
>using more than just the basic hotkey setups too - I have
one for melee with
>the inventory and melee slots - and one for songs (those
two I use together
>when grouping where I don't want to pull lots of things
with the DDD/CoD
>songs)- but I also have one that has DDD/CoD/Hymn AND a
melee slot with two
>inventory slots - where I switch the horn with the lute and
have the drum
>handy in case I need to run....
>
>
>Brangwen Incantare
>
>>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
lol@... with the subject submissions.
>


[Attachments have been removed from this message]
